listitem.para: YALI, the installer of Pardus, gained LVM/RAID and UUID support.
The user interface is completely redesigned to improve the usability.
Users are now able to select between Open Source and proprietary drivers for their NVIDIA video adapters.
Some of the settings which were asked during the installation in Pardus &PREVVER; are now moved into a different application which shows up once during the first boot after the installation.
Kaptan, the desktop customization tool of Pardus, now optionally captures your picture and sets it as your avatar in KDE.
Users are now able to select their preferred icon theme which will be used in their KDE desktop environment.
The user interface is completely redesigned to improve the usability.
Pisi now internally uses XZ as the default compression algorithm.
Binary package names now reflects the architecture and the distribution release for which the package is built.
Various speed enhancements has been done in the core components for a better package management experience.
Users are now able to vote for a package and see the screenshots of graphical applications shipped within packages.
The graphical user interface is redesigned to improve the usability. Various speed enhancements has been done for a better graphical package management experience.
A lot of KDE integration work has been done including the usage of KDE system tray.
Kernel - The Linux kernel shipped with Pardus &PRODVER; is &KERNELVER; which is the latest stable kernel released on 2011/01/05.
Plymouth - The bootsplash technology used in Pardus &PREVVER; is completely dropped and replaced by the new Plymouth engine.
X.org - xorg-server is updated to &XORGVER;, improvements to the automatic driver configuration mechanism has been done by our developers.
TeX Live - TeX Live documentation stack is updated to &TEXLIVEVER;.

section.title: Changes in KDE Desktop Environment
section.para: Pardus &PRODVER; comes with 3rd generation KDE, KDE &KDEVER;. The base packages also contains numerous backports and fixes which will improve the stability of your desktop experience significantly.
KDE &KDEVER; offers high performance, stability, usability for desktop experience.

section.title: Visual Enhancements
section.para: Tango and BC Tango icon themes are provided within the installation image. Users can set this icon theme through Kaptan or Tasma.

section.title: Network Management
section.para: Besides switching to GNOME NetworkManager as the default networking backend, Pardus &PRODVER; comes with a heavily improved and modified KDE Network Management tool to give their users a much more consistent networking experience.

With this new networking backend, users are now able to easily set up their Ethernet (With support for 802.1x authentication), 802.11 Wireless (With support for WEP/WPA/WPA2/WPA-EAP and 802.1x authentication), EDGE/3G/CDMA and VPN networks.

section.title: Mozilla Firefox
section.para: Pardus &PRODVER; comes with one of the most popular open source browsers, Mozilla Firefox &FIREFOXVER; as the default web browser application.

section.title: Amarok
section.para: Amarok, a cross-platform music player is set as the default audio playing application.

section.title: SMPlayer
section.para: SMplayer, a Qt based frontend for MPlayer is set as the default Video/VCD/DVD playing application as it is well integrated with KDE desktop environment in terms of usability and graphical user interface and supports playing a wide range of video file types thanks to the MPlayer backend.

section.title: KsCD
section.para: KsCD, is set as the default Audio CD playing application.

section.title: Web Browsers
section.para: Although not included in the installation images, a wide range of web browsers including Chromium browser, rekonq, Arora and Opera are available for installation through the package manager.

section.title: System Settings
section.para: Panda (Pardus alternative driver administration) is a new System Settings module which allows users to change the driver between Open Source and proprietary one for NVIDIA and ATI display adapters.
Users are now able to set up their Bluetooth devices, Wacom tablets and Synaptics touchpads through System Settings.
The default language used throughout the whole system can now be changed through the locale settings section.

section.title: Office Suite
section.para: LibreOffice, an Open Source personal productivity suite sponsored by the Document Foundation, is now the default Office Suite in Pardus &PRODVER;.

section.title: Games
section.para: Pardus &PRODVER; continues the tradition of giving importance to the quality of games offered to their users. The default installation now includes the board and logic games provided by the kdegames package.

section.title: Other Changes
section.para: Firefox gets new stable release rapidly. &FIREFOXVER; release presents many new features like the new interface of the browser as well as plugin management new interface, tab grouping, bookmarks between computers, passwords and history matching, a new plug-in interface. HTML5, CSS3 and WebM technology supports are also most important features for the developers.
